Job Title: Field Construction Coordinator

Location: Fort Smith, AR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Description

Job Summary:

The Field Construction Coordinator, under direction and guidance, has knowledge of current construction work safe practices. In this role, you will assist with documentation and compiling data for crews that are building telecommunications networks.

Apply today to join the Ledcor Technical Services team!

We support our employees with training to develop skills, knowledge, and abilities.

We offer an industry-leading benefits package, ongoing employee training and development, team building and career growth opportunities.

Essential Responsibilities:

Assisting Construction and Engineering teams with various field and office activities, including but not limited to field data collection, tracking of project milestones and financial deadlines, assists with the creation and maintenance of the project schedule, and provides ongoing updates to project stakeholdersCompile and process general construction documentation, including: As-builts, redlines, construction photos, fiber sequential sheets, splice and test documentation and splice redline sheetsCoordinate with Engineering and Construction vendors and inhouse self-perform resources in daily OSP operations activitiesSupports the subcontract and supplier tender and management process and assists with the review of invoices and progress claimsRequesting materials from warehouse and documenting consumption on those materialsData entry for daily production, employee timesheets, equipment timesheets, and for subcontractorsAbility to read construction drawings to assist the Superintendent with pre-construction walk out, compiling constructability notes, white line and calling in locates.Promotes Ledcor safety culture on the project by taking an active role in the implementation of the Project Specific Safety Program (PSSP) to achieve compliance with corporate safety manuals and all regulatory boards and authorities.

Qualifications:

Minimum 1 year of construction experience.Combination of work experience and/or technical training in an industry-related trade certification or education programPrevious experience as Coordinator, Data Entry specialist is an asset.Experience in telecommunications/wireless industry preferred.General understanding of construction documents, drawings, and specificationsKnowledge of current construction practicesStrong computer skills with an aptitude for learning new programs Familiarity with scheduling software an asset.Proficiency with Quickbase, Bluebeam Review Extreme, Office 365, SharePoint, Google Drive/Docs/Sheets, and GPS Photo AppsExcellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills Ability to prioritize in a fast-paced work environment, managing time sensitive issues and deadlines.Ability to work with little supervision.

Additional Information:

Company Description

Ledcor Technical Services (LTS) designs, builds, and maintains wireline or wireless networks that span North America and beyond. We are a proven leader and innovator in telecommunications network construction, maintenance, and service installation and repair.

But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!

Employment Equity

At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, Veteran status or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.

Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. For more information about Ledcor’s Inclusion and Diversity initiatives, please visit our I&D page. Adjustments will be provided in all parts of our hiring process. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance by submitting a request via email.

All applicants must be able to show proof of eligibility to work in the United States.

Link to: https://www.uscis.gov/e-verify

, Fort Smith, AR

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
